text: Pours a clear yellow with a quickly dissipating white head. Aroma is pear, and flavor is tart fruit. Great aroma. I enjoyed this.
Bottle. Pours a clear pale pale yellow with some light carbonation. Aromas of pear and white grape juice. Flavor is zingy. Lots of pear and tart edginess. Clean on the palate.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Draft - Sweet pear and apple. Very pale clear yellow, almost clear. Pear, medium sweet tannic and very dry.
Had on tap at their place in Spring Hill. Aroma is pears and is fairly tart. Color is very light yellow to green. Very nice perry.

Draft on tap at the brewpub (Spring Lake, MI). Pours a pale champagne hue, a faint hazy hue with some lively bubbles. Loose ring of head dies to a tiny ring, small lacing. Aromas are touch of honey, apple and pear sweetness meet, touches of crisp green, sweet pear juice and a kiss of white grape. Faint peach, more pear, a bit of yeastiness. Clean, fruity and deep. Initial is a bit tart, lighter on the palate with pear, gentle kiss of honey, faint apple. Nice tartess and bite permeate into the middle. Some gentle white grape, a nice sour bite and bit of fuzziness hits the palate. Lively, fresh tart with a lighter body, gentle carbonation. Finish is dry, a gentle champagne yeast with touches of tartness lingering on. Tasty, light and tart. Nice stuff.

Bottle. Poured clear pale color with a average sparkling white head that mostly lasted with average legs. Medium to heavy green pear fruit aroma. Medium to abundant body with a smooth dry texture and soft carbonation. Medium sweet pear flavor with a medium sweet fruit finish of moderate duration. This cider surpassed my expectations.
tap. Golden with small head. Very tart perry. I havent had that many, but this is by far the dryest Ive had. I miss the sweetness, but its excellent nonetheless.

750ml bottle, thanks to tmoney99 for sharing. Its spelled on the label as "Bon Chretien", with an accent over the 1st e. 2013 vintage. Totally clear, almost colorles color. Just a light yellow hue. Thin ring of off-white head. Great, lightly tart taste. Minimal sweet. Nice tartness. Good clean pear aroma, lightly spicy, good skin component. Medium-plus body. Smooth, kind of crisp, lighter carbonation. Very satisfyingly dry finish. Definitely a stand-out perry. Maybe one of the best Ive ever had.

750 ml bottle to snifter (shared by Tmoney99). Looks good; a transparent light gold with thin white lacing. Smells solid; a very nice, well-balanced pear presence. Tastes like it smells with a tart, fairly dry mouthfeel. I like that its a tarter pear than a sweeter pear; puts it at the top of my Perry list. Would love to see this oaked.
Draft. One of the more flavorful Perrys Ive had. Even a subtle tartneas. Dry finish.
